books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee. It follows the story of a young girl, Scout Finch, and her brother Jem, as their father, Atticus Finch, defends a black man accused of raping a white woman in the racially divided town of Maycomb, Alabama.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell. It is set in the year 1984 when most of the world's population lives under the control of omnipresent government surveillance and public manipulation.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald. Set in the summer of 1922, the story explores themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the first book in the Harry Potter series. It follows the story of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
